perturbation.original_text: For the purposes of this definition, "control" (including the terms "controlled by" and "under common control with") with respect to the Source: CHINA REAL ESTATE INFORMATION CORP, F-1, 9/29/2009 relationship between or among two or more Persons, means the possession, directly or indirectly or as trustee, personal representative or executor, of the power to direct or cause the direction of the affairs or management of a Person, whether through the ownership of voting securities, as trustee, personal representative or executor, by contract, credit arrangement or otherwise.
perturbation.changed_text: For the purposes of this definition, "control" (including the terms "controlled by" and "under common control with") with respect to the relationship between or among two or more Persons, means the ability to influence, directly or indirectly, the affairs or management of a Person, whether through ownership, contractual agreements, familial relationship, or any other means. This definition shall be interpreted broadly to encompass any form of influence, regardless of the percentage of ownership or the formality of the arrangement.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text introduces an in-text contradiction by changing the definition of "control." Originally, control was defined as the power to direct affairs through ownership of voting securities, trusteeship, contract, or credit arrangement. The change broadens this to 'ability to influence' through any means, including familial relationships, and states it should be interpreted broadly, moving away from the original, more specific criteria. This contradicts the original definition, which relies on more concrete and measurable elements like ownership of voting securities or formal agreements. This broadens the scope of 'control' which creates uncertainty in various parts of the agreement that rely on the original definition.
perturbation.contradicted_text: As used herein, the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them below. "Action" has the meaning set forth in Section 8.1. "Affiliate" means, when used with respect to any specified Person, a Person that directly or indirectly through one or more intermediaries, controls, is controlled by, or is under common control with, such specified Person. For the purposes of this definition, "control" (including the terms "controlled by" and "under common control with") with respect to the relationship between or among two or more Persons, means the ability to influence, directly or indirectly, the affairs or management of a Person, whether through ownership, contractual agreements, familial relationship, or any other means. This definition shall be interpreted broadly to encompass any form of influence, regardless of the percentage of ownership or the formality of the arrangement. "Agency Agreement" means that certain Advertising Sale Agency Agreement by and between SINA Corporation and China Online Housing Technology Corporation, dated as of the date hereof. "Business" means an online real estate media platform in the PRC that (i) provides information and updates related to real estate, home furnishing and construction in the PRC and provides real estate, home furnishing and construction advertising services, and (ii) operates a business-to- business and business-to-consumer Internet platform targeting participants in the PRC real estate industry, in each case, as currently conducted or contemplated to be conducted on the websites owned or operated by Licensee or any of Licensee's Affiliates in the PRC.

perturbation.original_text: Licensee agrees to use the Licensed Domain Names only in accordance with such content distribution policy that Licensor uses in connection with its own business, and as may be established by Licensor and communicated in writing in advance to Licensee from time to time or as may otherwise be agreed to by the Parties from time to time, provided that Licensee shall be afforded the same period of time to implement any such content distribution policy as is afforded to Licensor's Affiliates and other third parties.
perturbation.changed_text: Licensee agrees to use the Licensed Domain Names only in accordance with such content distribution policy that Licensor uses in connection with its own business, and as may be established unilaterally by Licensor at any time without prior notice to or agreement from Licensee. Licensee shall have no recourse or right to contest any changes to the content distribution policy, regardless of its impact on Licensee's operations.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by removing the requirement for Licensor to communicate changes to the content distribution policy in writing in advance and allowing Licensor to unilaterally establish policies without agreement from Licensee. This contradicts the original clause that ensures Licensee is afforded the same period of time to implement any new content distribution policy as Licensor's Affiliates and other third parties, as the change does not consider the potential impact on Licensee's operations. The insertion is conflicting in the sense it alters power dynamics in how policies are implemented.
perturbation.contradicted_text: Licensee Control. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Licensee shall be entitled to exercise exclusive control over all aspects of the websites and the Business associated with the Licensed Domain Names including, without limitation, the operation, the look-and- feel and the Content of such websites. 3.2. Content Distribution. Licensor shall make available to Licensee the Licensed Content in substantially the same manner and with substantially the same speed and efficiency as such Licensed Content was made available to SINA Leju prior to the Effective Date, namely through Licensor's content database, but in no event with less speed, efficiency, or a lesser level of access than Licensor provides with respect to its own operations. Licensee agrees to use the Licensed Domain Names only in accordance with such content distribution policy that Licensor uses in connection with its own business, and as may be established unilaterally by Licensor at any time without prior notice to or agreement from Licensee. Licensee shall have no recourse or right to contest any changes to the content distribution policy, regardless of its impact on Licensee's operations. 3.3. Website Monitoring and Censoring.

perturbation.original_text: Upon termination (but not expiration) of this Agreement for any reason, Licensee shall be entitled to use the Licensed Domain Names and Licensed Content for a limited period of time, not to exceed ninety (90) days, during which it shall diligently work to transition to another solution.
perturbation.changed_text: Upon termination (but not expiration) of this Agreement for any reason, Licensee shall be entitled to use the Licensed Domain Names and Licensed Content for a limited period of time, not to exceed thirty (30) days, during which it shall diligently work to transition to another solution. However, if the termination is due to a breach by Licensee, this transition period shall be reduced to zero (0) days, and all rights to use the Licensed Domain Names and Licensed Content shall immediately cease.
perturbation.explanation: The modification reduces the transition period from 90 days to 30 days and introduces a condition where the transition period is eliminated entirely if the termination is due to a breach by Licensee. This in-text contradicts the initial clause granting a transition period upon termination for any reason, creating ambiguity and potential disputes over the actual transition timeframe. As the previous clause stated the transition period shall be 90 days, this new clause introduces uncertainty regarding what is to be followed, 90 or 30 days.
perturbation.contradicted_text: (a) Upon termination (but not expiration) of this Agreement for any reason, Licensee shall be entitled to use the Licensed Domain Names and Licensed Content for a limited period of time, not to exceed thirty (30) days, during which it shall diligently work to transition to another solution. However, if the termination is due to a breach by Licensee, this transition period shall be reduced to zero (0) days, and all rights to use the Licensed Domain Names and Licensed Content shall immediately cease. (i) all rights granted to Licensee under this Agreement with respect to the Licensed Domain Names and Licensed Content shall immediately cease, and (ii) Licensee shall immediately discontinue all use of the Licensed Domain Names and Licensed Content.
